note.p: Death: His house, Church Street, Reigate, Surrey (19 May 1824)
Education: Clare College, Cambridge; BA (1752), MA (1755)

Career: Barrister, Inner Temple (1750); Fellow of Clare (1756-1759); Common Pleader, City of London (1762-1780); Attorney-General of Quebec (1766-1769); Cursitor Baron of the Exchequer (1773-1824); Judge of the Sheriff's Court of London (1780-1822)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Venn
References: L B Glyn, 'Israel Lyons: a short but starry career. The life of an eighteenth-century Jewish botanist and astronomer' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 275-305
